questions.text: Does your organization process personal data related to individuals in Saudi Arabia, regardless of location? [PDPL Article 2]
options: No processing of Saudi personal data

recommendations.Partially, needs improvement: Enhance documentation practices to comply with PDPL requirements. Maintain clear records of all processing activities involving Saudi personal data.
recommendations.No, not applicable: Review your data processing activities to confirm no Saudi personal data is involved. Reassess periodically.
recommendations.No processing of Saudi personal data: Continue monitoring for any changes in data processing scope.

questions.text: Does your organization conduct regular audits of personal data processing activities? [PDPL Article 31]

recommendations.Partially implemented: Implement comprehensive audit processes covering all PDPL requirements.
recommendations.No audits conducted: Establish a formal internal audit schedule to assess data processing compliance with PDPL.

questions.text: Does your organization maintain a Record of Processing Activities (RoPA) documenting all personal data processing? [PDPL Article 31]

recommendations.Partially documented: Complete your RoPA to include all required details as per PDPL.
recommendations.No RoPA maintained: Create a centralized RoPA including all data processing activities, purposes, categories of data subjects, retention periods, and third-party disclosures.

questions.text: Does your organization have measures in place to identify and document the legal basis for processing personal data under PDPL? [PDPL Article 5, 6, 7, 10]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Establish a framework to identify and document the legal basis for each processing activity (consent, contract, legal obligation, vital interest, public interest, or legitimate interest).

questions.text: Where 'Consent' is identified as the legal basis, does your organization have an established process for obtaining, recording, and managing consent? [PDPL Article 5, 9]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Implement a robust consent management system that clearly requests, records, and tracks consent from individuals.

questions.text: Does your organization have measures in place to identify and document any exemptions or special cases under PDPL (e.g., public interest, security, health)? [PDPL Article 6, 10, 23]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Establish a process to identify and document any processing activities that may qualify for exemptions under PDPL.

questions.text: Does your organization comply with the requirements for processing 'sensitive personal data' (health, genetic, credit, biometric, etc.) under PDPL? [PDPL Article 11, 23, 24]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Implement additional safeguards for processing sensitive personal data, including access controls, encryption, and strict documentation.

questions.text: Does your organization implement appropriate administrative, technical, and financial precautions to protect personal data in compliance with PDPL? [PDPL Article 19]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Implement comprehensive security measures including access controls, encryption, regular security testing, incident response, and staff training.

questions.text: Does your organization have procedures in place to enable individuals to exercise their rights under PDPL (access, correction, deletion, objection, etc.)? [PDPL Article 4, 21]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Establish comprehensive procedures for handling individual rights requests, including workflows for access, correction, deletion, and objection.

questions.text: Does your organization have a system in place to ensure individuals can raise concerns or complaints regarding personal data processing? [PDPL Article 34]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Establish a formal complaints handling process with clear procedures and timeframes for response.

questions.text: Does your organization have clearly defined, approved, and communicated data protection policies, with compliance monitored across the organization? [PDPL Article 10, 19]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Develop, approve, and communicate comprehensive data protection policies. Implement monitoring mechanisms to ensure ongoing compliance.

questions.text: Does your organization have a governance framework that sets out roles and responsibilities for data privacy? [PDPL Article 30]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Establish a formal data privacy governance framework. Consider appointing a Data Protection Officer (DPO) or privacy team.

questions.text: Does your organization provide regular data privacy training and awareness programs for employees? [PDPL Article 19]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Implement regular data privacy training and maintain records of training completion.

sections.name: Data Privacy Impact Assessment (DPIA) & Privacy by Design

questions.text: Is there a formal, documented framework to conduct and manage Data Privacy Impact Assessments (DPIAs) for high-risk processing activities? [PDPL Article 22]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Develop a standardized DPIA framework and process for new or changed processing activities.

questions.text: Is there a framework in place to embed data privacy by design and default within the organization? [PDPL Article 19]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Integrate privacy considerations into all processes, products, and services from the earliest stages.

sections.name: Cross Border Data Flows & Third Party Agreements

questions.text: Does your organization ensure an adequate level of protection for personal data transferred outside Saudi Arabia, including conducting Transfer Impact Assessments? [PDPL Article 29]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Implement mechanisms (e.g., standard contractual clauses, binding corporate rules) for international data transfers. Maintain documentation of transfer impact assessments.

questions.text: Does your organization have written contracts with processors that process personal data on your behalf, including requirements for sub-processors? [PDPL Article 8]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Establish formal written agreements with all data processors, including confidentiality, security, and sub-processor management.

questions.text: Does your organization have a formal, documented process to identify and respond to privacy-related incidents and breaches? [PDPL Article 20]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Establish a comprehensive data breach response plan, including detection, notification, containment, and post-incident review.

questions.text: Is your organization registered as a Controller with the Saudi Data & Artificial Intelligence Authority (SDAIA), and are all registrations and documentation up to date? [PDPL Article 30, 31]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Register as a Controller with SDAIA and maintain up-to-date documentation of processing activities.

questions.text: Does your organization take account of the PDPL requirements for processing personal data of children or other vulnerable groups? [PDPL Article 5, 9]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Implement enhanced protection measures for children's data, including age verification, parental consent, and strict data minimization.

questions.text: Does your organization take sufficient steps to verify the accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of personal data processed? [PDPL Article 14]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Establish procedures to regularly review and update personal data to ensure it remains accurate and relevant.

questions.text: Does your organization provide a clear privacy policy to data subjects, including information on processing purposes, data categories, retention, and rights? [PDPL Article 12, 13]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Develop and publish a comprehensive privacy policy that meets PDPL requirements, and ensure it is easily accessible to data subjects.

questions.text: Does your organization have a documented process for timely destruction of personal data that is no longer necessary for its collection purpose? [PDPL Article 18]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Implement a data retention and destruction policy that ensures personal data is deleted or anonymized when no longer needed.

questions.text: Does your organization obtain explicit consent for marketing communications and provide clear opt-out mechanisms? [PDPL Article 25, 26]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Ensure marketing communications are sent only with explicit consent and provide easy opt-out options.

questions.text: Does your organization comply with PDPL requirements when processing personal data for scientific, research, or statistical purposes? [PDPL Article 27]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Ensure that processing for scientific, research, or statistical purposes is anonymized or pseudonymized, and that consent is obtained where required.

questions.text: Does your organization restrict copying of official documents containing identifiable personal data to cases required by law or competent authority? [PDPL Article 28]

recommendations.No - Not yet completed: Implement controls to ensure official documents are copied only when legally required or by authorized request.
